Joala BOM 1.2.0 API

Joala is a set of libraries to assist in writing tests based on JUnit testing framework.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
net.joala.bdd

Support to write JUnit tests in BDD style.
net.joala.bdd.aop

Aspects to support JUnit tests written with Gherkin like syntax.
net.joala.bdd.reference

References are used to carry information between steps.
net.joala.bdd.watcher

Watchers to be used as rules in JUnit tests to log Stories implemented as JUnit class and their corresponding test methods denoting scenarios.
net.joala.condition
Conditions to be used during testing.
net.joala.condition.timing  
net.joala.core.reflection  
net.joala.data
Contains classes to provide data as test artifacts for your tests.
net.joala.data.random
Contains classes to generate random data.
net.joala.dns
Joala DNS is meant for tests which normally would need to modify the etc/hosts file of your system.
net.joala.expression  
net.joala.expression.library.net  
net.joala.image

Classes for creating images on the fly for testing purpose.
net.joala.image.config

Classes for default configuration for image-builders.
net.joala.image.impl  
net.joala.junit
Lab features related to provide assistance in writing JUnit tests.
net.joala.matcher
Joala Matcher Library to extend Hamcrest matchers.
net.joala.matcher.decorator
Meta-Matchers modifying existing description of an embedded matcher.
net.joala.matcher.exception
Matchers for exceptions/throwables.
net.joala.matcher.net
Matchers for validating inet addresses and such.
net.joala.matcher.reflect  
net.joala.matcher.text  
net.joala.net
Labs features for dealing with HTTP Servers and such.
net.joala.testlet
Testlets are set of tests to apply to a software under test (SUT).
net.joala.time  

Joala is a set of libraries to assist in writing tests based on JUnit testing framework. The origin of Joala is the concept of waiting in tests implemented in the module joala-conditions.
